content: introducing nightfall - a quick and easy crochet shawl pattern suitable for a confident beginner the shawl is light and airy perfect for dressing up a summer outfit inspired by bohemian festival style with the simple fringing - great for draping around your shoulders on summer evenings the pattern is a triangle shawl using us treble stitches treble_crochet stitches in uk terms and works up fast includes a helpful photo tutorial for the first 12 row to get you started **materials** vidalana dream - night sports weight - 70% merino / 20% silk / 10% cashmere - 100g/301m 2 skeins 4mm crochet hook you can use 600m of any sports weight yarn or yarn weight of your choice and matching hook **measurements** shawl pictured measures 72 183cm wide x 34 86cm deep after blocking without fringe only basic stitches are used in this pattern but some concentration is required until the row increases are established i have provided stitch counts to help keep you on track you can find a free version on my blog
